title: Invalid size while trying to read a Timestamp
body:
### Rust Version

1.89.0

### Diesel Version

2.3.1

### Diesel Features

mysql chrono

### Database Version

MariaDB 11.8.3

### Operating System Version

Debian trixie

### What happened?

Creating a struct representing a table row fails with:
```
thread 'main' panicked at src/main.rs:24:53:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: DeserializationError(DeserializeFieldError { field_name: Some("date"), error: "Received a buffer with an invalid size while trying to read a Timestamp value: Expected at least 48 bytes but got 40" })
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```

### What did you expect to happen?

Correct deserialization

### Additional details

This might be related to https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues/4699

### Steps to reproduce

```rust
The code below runs fine with Diesel v2.2.*. However, when switching to v2.3.1 (for instance, when running `cargo update`, I get the error above.

use diesel::prelude::*;
use diesel::RunQueryDsl;

diesel::table! {
    use diesel::sql_types::{Integer, Datetime};

    user (id) {
        id -> Integer,
        date -> Datetime,
    }
}

#[derive(Queryable)]
struct User {
    id: i32,
    date: chrono::NaiveDateTime,
}

#[tokio::main]
async fn main() {
    dotenvy::dotenv().ok();
    let database_url = std::env::var("DATABASE_URL").unwrap();
    let mut conn = diesel::MysqlConnection::establish(&database_url).unwrap();

    crate::user::dsl::user.first::<User>(&mut conn).unwrap();
}
```

### Compile time error

_No response_

### Checklist

- [x] I have already looked over the [issue tracker](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues) and the [discussion forum](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/discussions) for similar possible closed issues.

- [x] This issue can be reproduced on Rust's stable channel. (Please submit the issue in the Rust issue tracker instead if that's not the case)
- [ ] This issue can be reproduced without requiring a third party crate
